exclamation.description: May the Lord watch between us (usually as an inscription on a piece of jewellery).

adjective.description: Designating a piece of jewellery with Mizpah inscribed upon it, intended to be given as a love token.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in The North American Review. From Hebrew Miṣpāh, the name of the cairn erected by Laban and Jacob as a sign of their association, a wordplay (interpretable as outlook-point; compare Hebrew miṣpeh watchtower) on the verb ṣapāh to watch, used in their agreement The Lord watch (Hebrew yiṣēp) between me and thee (i.e. to ensure the keeping of the covenant) (Genesis 31:49).
